text.en: And after that you have obtained faith, and have seen them with your eyes, you shall testify of them, by the power of God;
text.zh: 那是由於你們的信心，你們才可以看到這些，那也是古代先知所具有的信心。

text.en: And this you shall do that my servant Joseph Smith, Jun., may not be destroyed, that I may bring about my righteous purposes unto the children of men in this work.
text.zh: 在你們獲得了信心，又親眼見到這些東西後，就要藉神的能力為這些東西作見證；

text.en: And ye shall testify that you have seen them, even as my servant Joseph Smith, Jun., has seen them; for it is by my power that he has seen them, and it is because he had faith.
text.zh: 你們要這樣做，使我的僕人小約瑟·斯密不致被毀滅，也使我藉這事工，為了人類兒女而實現我正義的目的。

text.en: And he has translated the book, even that part which I have commanded him, and as your Lord and your God liveth it is true.
text.zh: 你們要見證你們曾見到這些東西就像我的僕人小約瑟·斯密那樣見到這些東西；他見到這些東西，是藉著我的能力，也因為他有信心。

text.en: Wherefore, you have received the same power, and the same faith, and the same gift like unto him;
text.zh: 而且他翻譯了那本書，即我命令他的那部分，像你們的主和你們的神活著一樣，那是真實的。

text.en: And if you do these last commandments of mine, which I have given you, the gates of hell shall not prevail against you; for my grace is sufficient for you, and you shall be lifted up at the last day.
text.zh: 因此，你們已獲得像他一樣的能力、一樣的信心和一樣的恩賜；

text.en: And I, Jesus Christ, your Lord and your God, have spoken it unto you, that I might bring about my righteous purposes unto the children of men. Amen.
text.zh: 如果你們遵行我以上給你們的這些誡命，地獄的門必不能勝過你們；因為我對你們的恩典是充分的，到末日，你們必被高舉。

introduction.en: Revelation to Joseph Smith the Prophet, Oliver Cowdery, and David Whitmer, given at Fayette, New York, June 1829. According to the Prophet, this revelation made known “the calling of twelve apostles in these last days, and also instructions relative to building up the Church.”

text.en: –5, Scriptures show how to build up the Church; 6–8, The world is ripening in iniquity; 9–16, The worth of souls is great; 17–25, To gain salvation, men must take upon themselves the name of Christ; 26–36, The calling and mission of the Twelve are revealed; 37–39, Oliver Cowdery and David Whitmer are to search out the Twelve; 40–47, To gain salvation, men must repent, be baptized, and keep the commandments.
text.zh: 年6月，於紐約，菲也特，給先知約瑟·斯密、奧利佛·考德里和大衛·惠特茂的啟示。根據先知所述，本啟示透露「在此末世十二使徒的召喚，以及有關建立教會的指示。」

text.en: Now, behold, because of the thing which you, my servant Oliver Cowdery, have desired to know of me, I give unto you these words:
text.zh: -5，經文指示如何建立教會；6-8，世界正在罪惡中成熟；9-16，靈魂的價值是大的；17-25，世人必須承受基督的名，才能獲得救恩；26-36，啟示十二使徒的召喚和使命；37-39，奧利佛·考德里和大衛·惠特茂要找出十二使徒；40-47，世人必須悔改、受洗、遵守誡命，才能獲得救恩。

text.en: Behold, I have manifested unto you, by my Spirit in many instances, that the things which you have written are true; wherefore you know that they are true.
text.zh: 現在，看啊，我的僕人奧利佛·考德里，因為你求問我，想知道這事，所以我把這些話告訴你：

text.en: And if you know that they are true, behold, I give unto you a commandment, that you rely upon the things which are written;
text.zh: 看啊，我多次藉我的靈向你顯明你抄寫的事是真的，因此你知道那些事是真的。

text.en: For in them are all things written concerning the foundation of my church, my gospel, and my rock.
text.zh: 如果你知道那些事是真的，看啊，我給你一條誡命，你要信靠所寫的事；

text.en: Wherefore, if you shall build up my church, upon the foundation of my gospel and my rock, the gates of hell shall not prevail against you.
text.zh: 因為其中記載了關於我教會、我福音以及我磐石的基礎的一切事。

text.en: Behold, the world is ripening in iniquity; and it must needs be that the children of men are stirred up unto repentance, both the Gentiles and also the house of Israel.
text.zh: 因此，如果你將我的教會建立在我的福音和磐石的基礎上，地獄的門必不能勝過你。

text.en: Wherefore, as thou hast been baptized by the hands of my servant Joseph Smith, Jun., according to that which I have commanded him, he hath fulfilled the thing which I commanded him.
text.zh: 看啊，世界正在罪惡中成熟，必須喚醒人類兒女悔改，不論外邦人或以色列家族。

text.en: And now, marvel not that I have called him unto mine own purpose, which purpose is known in me; wherefore, if he shall be diligent in keeping my commandments he shall be blessed unto eternal life; and his name is Joseph.
text.zh: 因此，既然你已由我僕人小約瑟·斯密，依照我給他的命令親手為你施洗，他已完成我命令他的事。

text.en: And now, Oliver Cowdery, I speak unto you, and also unto David Whitmer, by the way of commandment; for, behold, I command all men everywhere to repent, and I speak unto you, even as unto Paul mine apostle, for you are called even with that same calling with which he was called.
text.zh: 現在，不要驚奇我為了自己的目的召喚他，我知道這目的；所以，如果他勤勉遵守我的誡命，他必蒙得永生的祝福；他的名字是約瑟。

text.en: Remember the worth of souls is great in the sight of God;
text.zh: 現在，奧利佛·考德里，我用誡命的方式對你，也對大衛·惠特茂說；因為，看啊，我命令各地的人悔改，而我對你們說的，如同我對我的使徒保羅說的一樣，因為你們蒙得的召喚和他蒙得的召喚是一樣的。

text.en: For, behold, the Lord your Redeemer suffered death in the flesh; wherefore he suffered the pain of all men, that all men might repent and come unto him.
text.zh: 記住，在神眼中，靈魂的價值是大的；

text.en: And he hath risen again from the dead, that he might bring all men unto him, on conditions of repentance.
text.zh: 因為看啊，主，你們的救贖主，忍受了肉身的死亡；因此，祂忍受了全人類的痛苦，讓全人類可以悔改而歸向祂。

text.en: And how great is his joy in the soul that repenteth!
text.zh: 而且祂已從死裡復活，使祂能帶領全人類在悔改的條件下歸向祂。

text.en: Wherefore, you are called to cry repentance unto this people.
text.zh: 對悔改的靈魂，祂的快樂是多麼大呀！

text.en: And if it so be that you should labor all your days in crying repentance unto this people, and bring, save it be one soul unto me, how great shall be your joy with him in the kingdom of my Father!
text.zh: 所以，你們蒙召呼籲這人民悔改。

text.en: And now, if your joy will be great with one soul that you have brought unto me into the kingdom of my Father, how great will be your joy if you should bring many souls unto me!
text.zh: 假如你們辛勤終生，呼籲這人民悔改，即使只帶領一個靈魂歸向我，你們同他在我父國度中的快樂該是多麼大呀！

text.en: Behold, you have my gospel before you, and my rock, and my salvation.
text.zh: 假如你們帶領一個靈魂歸向我，進入我父的國度，你們就那麼快樂，那麼，如果你們帶領很多靈魂歸向我，你們的快樂將是多麼大呀！

text.en: Ask the Father in my name in faith, believing that you shall receive, and you shall have the Holy Ghost, which manifesteth all things which are expedient unto the children of men.
text.zh: 看啊，你們有我的福音在你們面前，還有我的磐石和我的救恩。

text.en: And if you have not faith, hope, and charity, you can do nothing.
text.zh: 奉我的名祈求父，憑信心相信你們會得到，你們就會有聖靈，聖靈會向人類兒女顯示一切他們需要的事。

text.en: Contend against no church, save it be the church of the devil.
text.zh: 如果你們沒有信心、希望、仁愛，你們什麼事都做不成。

text.en: Take upon you the name of Christ, and speak the truth in soberness.
text.zh: 除了魔鬼的教會，勿與任何教會相爭。

text.en: And as many as repent and are baptized in my name, which is Jesus Christ, and endure to the end, the same shall be saved.
text.zh: 承受基督的名，嚴肅地宣講真理。

text.en: Behold, Jesus Christ is the name which is given of the Father, and there is none other name given whereby man can be saved;
text.zh: 凡悔改、奉我耶穌基督的名受洗並持守到底的，必然得救。

text.en: Wherefore, all men must take upon them the name which is given of the Father, for in that name shall they be called at the last day;
text.zh: 看啊，耶穌基督是父所給的名，祂沒有給別的名，人可藉以得救；

text.en: Wherefore, if they know not the name by which they are called, they cannot have place in the kingdom of my Father.
text.zh: 因此，全人類都必須承受父所給的名，因為在末日他們都要用這名來被稱呼；

text.en: And now, behold, there are others who are called to declare my gospel, both unto Gentile and unto Jew;
text.zh: 因此，如果他們不知道他們要被稱呼的名，在我父的國度中，就沒有他們的地方。

text.en: Yea, even twelve; and the Twelve shall be my disciples, and they shall take upon them my name; and the Twelve are they who shall desire to take upon them my name with full purpose of heart.
text.zh: 現在，看啊，還有其他人被召喚來向外邦人和猶太人宣講我的福音；

text.en: And if they desire to take upon them my name with full purpose of heart, they are called to go into all the world to preach my gospel unto every creature.
text.zh: 是的，有十二位；這十二人將是我的門徒，他們將承受我的名；這十二人是全心全意渴望承受我名的人。

text.en: And they are they who are ordained of me to baptize in my name, according to that which is written;
text.zh: 如果他們全心全意渴望承受我的名，他們就蒙召喚往普天下去，傳福音給萬民聽。

text.en: And you have that which is written before you; wherefore, you must perform it according to the words which are written.
text.zh: 他們就是由我按立，依照記載，奉我的名去施洗的人；

text.en: And now I speak unto you, the Twelve—Behold, my grace is sufficient for you; you must walk uprightly before me and sin not.
text.zh: 那記載就在你們面前；因此，你們一定要依照記載的話去執行。

text.en: And, behold, you are they who are ordained of me to ordain priests and teachers; to declare my gospel, according to the power of the Holy Ghost which is in you, and according to the callings and gifts of God unto men;
text.zh: 現在我對你們這十二人說話——看啊，我對你們的恩典是充分的；你們必須正直地行走在我面前，不要犯罪。

text.en: And I, Jesus Christ, your Lord and your God, have spoken it.
text.zh: 並且，看啊，你們就是由我按立來按立祭司和教師的人；要按照你們身上的聖靈的力量，並按照神給世人的召喚和恩賜，宣講我的福音；

text.en: These words are not of men nor of man, but of me; wherefore, you shall testify they are of me and not of man;
text.zh: 我，耶穌基督，你們的主和你們的神，說這話。

text.en: For it is my voice which speaketh them unto you; for they are given by my Spirit unto you, and by my power you can read them one to another; and save it were by my power you could not have them;
text.zh: 這些話不是眾人的，也不是某人的，而是我的；因此，你們要見證這些話是我的，不是某人的；

text.en: Wherefore, you can testify that you have heard my voice, and know my words.
text.zh: 因為是我的聲音對你們說這些話；這些話是我的靈給你們的，你們可以藉我的能力讀給彼此聽；若不藉我的能力，你們就得不到這些話；

text.en: And now, behold, I give unto you, Oliver Cowdery, and also unto David Whitmer, that you shall search out the Twelve, who shall have the desires of which I have spoken;
text.zh: 因此，你們可以見證，你們聽過我的聲音，知道我的話。

text.en: And by their desires and their works you shall know them.
text.zh: 現在，看啊，我吩咐你，奧利佛·考德里，也吩咐大衛·惠特茂，去找出這十二位有我所說的那種渴望的人。

text.en: And when you have found them you shall show these things unto them.
text.zh: 你們從他們的渴望和行為，就可認出他們來。

text.en: And you shall fall down and worship the Father in my name.
text.zh: 你們找到他們時，就把這些事物給他們看。

text.en: And you must preach unto the world, saying: You must repent and be baptized, in the name of Jesus Christ;
text.zh: 你們要俯伏，並奉我的名崇拜父。

text.en: For all men must repent and be baptized, and not only men, but women, and children who have arrived at the years of accountability.
text.zh: 你們一定要對世人宣講，說：你們必須悔改，奉耶穌基督的名受洗；

text.en: And now, after that you have received this, you must keep my commandments in all things;
text.zh: 因為全人類都必須悔改和受洗，不只是男人，還有女人和到達負責年齡的小孩。

text.en: And by your hands I will work a marvelous work among the children of men, unto the convincing of many of their sins, that they may come unto repentance, and that they may come unto the kingdom of my Father.
text.zh: 現在，你們已得到這些，就必須凡事遵守我的誡命；

text.en: Wherefore, the blessings which I give unto you are above all things.
text.zh: 我要藉你們的手在人類兒女中做奇妙的事工，勸許多人認清自己的罪，使他們前來悔改而歸向我父的國度。

text.en: And after that you have received this, if you keep not my commandments you cannot be saved in the kingdom of my Father.
text.zh: 因此，我給你們的祝福超乎一切。

text.en: Behold, I, Jesus Christ, your Lord and your God, and your Redeemer, by the power of my Spirit have spoken it. Amen.
text.zh: 你們得到這些後，若不遵守我的誡命，就不能在我父的國度中得救。

introduction.en: Revelation given through Joseph Smith, at Manchester, New York, likely in the summer of 1829. In his history, the Prophet introduces it as “a commandment of God and not of man, to Martin Harris, given by him who is Eternal.”
introduction.zh: 可能在1829年夏天，在紐約，曼徹斯特，透過約瑟·斯密給予的啟示。先知在其個人歷史中提到：「這是神的誡命，不是人的，是祂，永恆者，給馬丁·哈里斯的」。

text.en: –3, Christ has all power; 4–5, All men must repent or suffer; 6–12, Eternal punishment is God’s punishment; 13–20, Christ suffered for all, that they might not suffer if they would repent; 21–28, Preach the gospel of repentance; 29–41, Declare glad tidings.
text.zh: -3，基督有一切能力；4-5，全人類都必須悔改，否則就會受苦；6-12，神的懲罰是永恆懲罰；13-20，基督已為全人類受苦，如果世人悔改，就不會受苦；21-28，宣講悔改的福音；29-41，宣講佳音。

text.en: I am Alpha and Omega, Christ the Lord; yea, even I am he, the beginning and the end, the Redeemer of the world.
text.zh: 我是阿拉法和俄梅戛，是主基督；是的，我就是那位，是開始也是結束，是世界的救贖主。

text.en: I, having accomplished and finished the will of him whose I am, even the Father, concerning me—having done this that I might subdue all things unto myself—
text.zh: 我，已成就並完成我所屬於的那位，即父，對我的旨意——我完成了這事，好叫萬有歸服我——

text.en: Retaining all power, even to the destroying of Satan and his works at the end of the world, and the last great day of judgment, which I shall pass upon the inhabitants thereof, judging every man according to his works and the deeds which he hath done.
text.zh: 我保有一切能力，可以在世界末日及最後的大審判日摧毀撒但和他的工作，屆時我要審判世上居民，按照每個人的所作所為加以審判。

text.en: And surely every man must repent or suffer, for I, God, am endless.
text.zh: 的確，每個人都必須悔改，否則就會受苦，因為我，神，是無限的。

text.en: Wherefore, I revoke not the judgments which I shall pass, but woes shall go forth, weeping, wailing and gnashing of teeth, yea, to those who are found on my left hand.
text.zh: 因此，我不撤消我要作的判決，災禍必降下，是的，在我左邊的人，要哭泣、哀號、切齒了。

text.en: Nevertheless, it is not written that there shall be no end to this torment, but it is written endless torment.
text.zh: 然而，並沒有記載說這種痛苦沒有止境，只記載它是無限的痛苦。

text.en: Again, it is written eternal damnation; wherefore it is more express than other scriptures, that it might work upon the hearts of the children of men, altogether for my name’s glory.
text.zh: 另外，也有記載說永恆的罪罰；因此，這比其他經文明白，以便感化人類兒女的心，這都是為了我名的榮耀。

text.en: Wherefore, I will explain unto you this mystery, for it is meet unto you to know even as mine apostles.
text.zh: 因此，我要向你們說明這奧祕，因為你們適宜像我的使徒一樣，知道這奧祕。

text.en: I speak unto you that are chosen in this thing, even as one, that you may enter into my rest.
text.zh: 我對你們在這事上蒙揀選的人說話，如同對一個人說話，好讓你們進入我的安息。

text.en: For, behold, the mystery of godliness, how great is it! For, behold, I am endless, and the punishment which is given from my hand is endless punishment, for Endless is my name. Wherefore—
text.zh: 因為，看啊，神性的奧祕多麼偉大啊！因為，看啊，我是無限的，我的手所給予的懲罰是無限的懲罰，因為，無限是我的名。因此——

text.en: Eternal punishment is God’s punishment.
text.zh: 永恆懲罰就是神的懲罰。

text.en: Endless punishment is God’s punishment.
text.zh: 無限懲罰就是神的懲罰。

text.en: Wherefore, I command you to repent, and keep the commandments which you have received by the hand of my servant Joseph Smith, Jun., in my name;
text.zh: 因此，我命令你悔改，遵守你藉我僕人小約瑟·斯密之手，奉我的名接受的誡命；

text.en: And it is by my almighty power that you have received them;
text.zh: 那是藉著我無比的能力，你才能接受那些誡命；

text.en: Therefore I command you to repent—repent, lest I smite you by the rod of my mouth, and by my wrath, and by my anger, and your sufferings be sore—how sore you know not, how exquisite you know not, yea, how hard to bear you know not.
text.zh: 因此我命令你悔改——悔改，以免我用我口中的杖、用我的震怒、用我的怒氣擊打你，使你遭受劇烈的痛苦——多麼劇烈你不知道，多麼深切你不知道，是的，多麼難以忍受你也不知道。

text.en: For behold, I, God, have suffered these things for all, that they might not suffer if they would repent;
text.zh: 因為，看啊，我，神，替全人類承受了這些，他們若肯悔改就可以不受苦；

text.en: But if they would not repent they must suffer even as I;
text.zh: 但是他們若不肯悔改，就必定像我一樣受苦；

text.en: Which suffering caused myself, even God, the greatest of all, to tremble because of pain, and to bleed at every pore, and to suffer both body and spirit—and would that I might not drink the bitter cup, and shrink—
text.zh: 那種痛苦使我自己，就是神，一切中最偉大的，也因疼痛而顫抖，每個毛孔都流血，身體和靈都受苦——而且希望我可以不喝那苦杯，而且退縮——

text.en: Nevertheless, glory be to the Father, and I partook and finished my preparations unto the children of men.
text.zh: 然而，願榮耀歸於父，我飲了，並完成了我為人類兒女作的準備。

text.en: Wherefore, I command you again to repent, lest I humble you with my almighty power; and that you confess your sins, lest you suffer these punishments of which I have spoken, of which in the smallest, yea, even in the least degree you have tasted at the time I withdrew my Spirit.
text.zh: 因此，我再命令你悔改，以免我用我無比的能力使你謙卑；你也要承認你的罪，以免遭受我說的這些懲罰；你在我撤走我的靈時，嘗到的只是最小、最輕微的懲罰而已。

text.en: And I command you that you preach naught but repentance, and show not these things unto the world until it is wisdom in me.
text.zh: 我也命令你，除了宣講悔改之外，別的都不要講，而且在我的智慧認為適當以前，不要向世人顯示這些事。

text.en: For they cannot bear meat now, but milk they must receive; wherefore, they must not know these things, lest they perish.
text.zh: 因為他們現在不能消受肉類，只能接受乳類；因此，他們一定不可以知道這些事，以免滅亡。

text.en: Learn of me, and listen to my words; walk in the meekness of my Spirit, and you shall have peace in me.
text.zh: 向我學習，聽我的話；行走在我靈的溫順中，你必在我裡面得到平安。

text.en: I am Jesus Christ; I came by the will of the Father, and I do his will.
text.zh: 我是耶穌基督；我奉父的旨意來，照祂的旨意做。

text.en: And again, I command thee that thou shalt not covet thy neighbor’s wife; nor seek thy neighbor’s life.
text.zh: 還有，我命令你，不可貪戀鄰人的妻子；也不可謀害鄰人的性命。

text.en: And again, I command thee that thou shalt not covet thine own property, but impart it freely to the printing of the Book of Mormon, which contains the truth and the word of God—
text.zh: 還有，我命令你，不可貪戀自己的財產，要慷慨地拿出來印《摩爾門經》，那書包含真理和神的話——

text.en: Which is my word to the Gentile, that soon it may go to the Jew, of whom the Lamanites are a remnant, that they may believe the gospel, and look not for a Messiah to come who has already come.
text.zh: 那是我對外邦人講的話，不久會傳給猶太人，拉曼人就是他們的遺裔，好使他們相信福音，而不期待一位早已來過的彌賽亞的來臨。

text.en: And again, I command thee that thou shalt pray vocally as well as in thy heart; yea, before the world as well as in secret, in public as well as in private.
text.zh: 還有，我命令你，你要出聲禱告，也要在你心中禱告；是的，在世人面前，也要在隱密的地方，要在公開場合，也要在暗中。

text.en: And thou shalt declare glad tidings, yea, publish it upon the mountains, and upon every high place, and among every people that thou shalt be permitted to see.
text.zh: 你要宣講佳音，是的，在山上，在每個高處，在每個你被允許見到的民族中宣揚。

text.en: And thou shalt do it with all humility, trusting in me, reviling not against revilers.
text.zh: 你要滿懷謙卑地去做，信賴我，不要辱罵那辱罵人的。

text.en: And of tenets thou shalt not talk, but thou shalt declare repentance and faith on the Savior, and remission of sins by baptism, and by fire, yea, even the Holy Ghost.
text.zh: 不要談教條，只要宣講悔改、對救主的信心，以及藉著洗禮，和藉著火，是的，即聖靈，而來的罪的赦免。

text.en: Behold, this is a great and the last commandment which I shall give unto you concerning this matter; for this shall suffice for thy daily walk, even unto the end of thy life.
text.zh: 看啊，這是我針對此事給你的重大而最後的誡命；這夠你日常生活用了，甚至到你生命的結束。

text.en: And misery thou shalt receive if thou wilt slight these counsels, yea, even the destruction of thyself and property.
text.zh: 如果你輕視這些忠告，你必悲慘，是的，自己和財產都遭毀滅。

text.en: Impart a portion of thy property, yea, even part of thy lands, and all save the support of thy family.
text.zh: 拿出你部分的財產，是的，甚至你部分的土地，以及維持你家庭以外的一切。

text.en: Pay the debt thou hast contracted with the printer. Release thyself from bondage.
text.zh: 清償契約中欠印刷商的債務。解除你自己的束縛。

text.en: Leave thy house and home, except when thou shalt desire to see thy family;
text.zh: 離開你的住宅和家庭，除非你想探望你的家人。

text.en: And speak freely to all; yea, preach, exhort, declare the truth, even with a loud voice, with a sound of rejoicing, crying—Hosanna, hosanna, blessed be the name of the Lord God!
text.zh: 要向眾人坦率講話；是的，要用宏亮的聲音，用快樂的語調傳道、勸告、宣講真理，高喊——和散那，和散那，讚美主神的名！

text.en: Pray always, and I will pour out my Spirit upon you, and great shall be your blessing—yea, even more than if you should obtain treasures of earth and corruptibleness to the extent thereof.
text.zh: 一直禱告，我會用我的靈傾注你，你的祝福將是大的——是的，甚至比你可能獲得的，會腐朽的世上財寶還多。

text.en: Behold, canst thou read this without rejoicing and lifting up thy heart for gladness?
text.zh: 看啊，你讀了這些能不歡樂而滿懷喜悅嗎？

text.en: Or canst thou run about longer as a blind guide?
text.zh: 還是你能繼續像瞎眼領路的那樣四處跑？

text.en: Or canst thou be humble and meek, and conduct thyself wisely before me? Yea, come unto me thy Savior. Amen.
text.zh: 還是你能謙卑溫順，在我面前行事明智？是的，歸向我，你的救主。阿們。

introduction.en: Revelation on Church organization and government, given through Joseph Smith the Prophet, at or near Fayette, New York. Portions of this revelation may have been given as early as summer 1829. The complete revelation, known at the time as the Articles and Covenants, was likely recorded soon after April 6, 1830 (the day the Church was organized). The Prophet wrote, “We obtained of Him [Jesus Christ] the following, by the spirit of prophecy and revelation; which not only gave us much information, but also pointed out to us the precise day upon which, according to His will and commandment, we should proceed to organize His Church once more here upon the earth.”
introduction.zh: 有關教會組織和管理的啟示，在紐約，菲也特或附近，透過先知約瑟·斯密給予的。本啟示的某些部分可能早在1829年夏天就賜予了。全部的啟示，即當時人們所知的《條文和聖約》，可能是在1830年4月6日（教會成立當天）之後不久記錄的。先知寫道：「我們藉著預言和啟示之靈，從祂〔耶穌基督〕那裡獲得如下啟示；這啟示不僅提供許多信息，也確切指出該在那一天，照祂的意思和誡命，再次在世上組織祂的教會」。

text.en: –16, The Book of Mormon proves the divinity of the latter-day work; 17–28, The doctrines of creation, fall, atonement, and baptism are affirmed; 29–37, Laws governing repentance, justification, sanctification, and baptism are set forth; 38–67, Duties of elders, priests, teachers, and deacons are summarized; 68–74, Duties of members, blessing of children, and the mode of baptism are revealed; 75–84, Sacramental prayers and regulations governing Church membership are given.
text.zh: -16，《摩爾門經》證明後期事工的神聖；17-28，證實創造、墜落、贖罪和洗禮等教義；29-37，頒佈管理悔改、稱義、聖化及洗禮的律法；38-67，綜述長老、祭司、教師和執事的職責；68-74，啟示成員的職責、兒童的祝福和洗禮的方式；75-84，給予聖餐祈禱文及管理教籍的規定。

text.en: The rise of the Church of Christ in these last days, being one thousand eight hundred and thirty years since the coming of our Lord and Savior Jesus Christ in the flesh, it being regularly organized and established agreeable to the laws of our country, by the will and commandments of God, in the fourth month, and on the sixth day of the month which is called April—
text.zh: 基督的教會在此末世時代的興起，是在我們的主和救主耶穌基督在肉身中來臨後一千八百三十年第四個月，即四月，第六日，奉神的旨意和誡命，依我們國家的法律正式組織成立——

text.en: Which commandments were given to Joseph Smith, Jun., who was called of God, and ordained an apostle of Jesus Christ, to be the first elder of this church;
text.zh: 那些誡命是給小約瑟·斯密的；他蒙神召喚，被按立為耶穌基督的使徒和教會第一位長老；

text.en: And to Oliver Cowdery, who was also called of God, an apostle of Jesus Christ, to be the second elder of this church, and ordained under his hand;
text.zh: 並且是給奧利佛·考德里的；他也蒙神召喚，是耶穌基督的使徒，為教會第二位長老，並由他親手按立；

text.en: And this according to the grace of our Lord and Savior Jesus Christ, to whom be all glory, both now and forever. Amen.
text.zh: 這是依照我們的主和救主耶穌基督的恩典，願一切榮耀都歸給祂，從現在直到永遠，阿們。

text.en: After it was truly manifested unto this first elder that he had received a remission of his sins, he was entangled again in the vanities of the world;
text.zh: 在這第一位長老真實顯示他已獲得赦罪之後，他又為俗世虛榮所困；

text.en: But after repenting, and humbling himself sincerely, through faith, God ministered unto him by an holy angel, whose countenance was as lightning, and whose garments were pure and white above all other whiteness;
text.zh: 但他憑信心悔改，並誠心謙卑後，神藉著一位神聖天使施助他；那天使面如閃電，衣服純淨潔白無比；

text.en: And gave unto him commandments which inspired him;
text.zh: 給他誡命來啟發他；

text.en: And gave him power from on high, by the means which were before prepared, to translate the Book of Mormon;
text.zh: 也給他來自高天的力量，用已預備好的工具翻譯《摩爾門經》；

text.en: Which contains a record of a fallen people, and the fulness of the gospel of Jesus Christ to the Gentiles and to the Jews also;
text.zh: 這經典包含一個已滅亡的民族的紀錄，及給外邦人也給猶太人的耶穌基督的圓滿福音；

text.en: Which was given by inspiration, and is confirmed to others by the ministering of angels, and is declared unto the world by them—
text.zh: 那是憑靈感給予、由天使施助向其他人證實，並由他們向世人宣布的——

text.en: Proving to the world that the holy scriptures are true, and that God does inspire men and call them to his holy work in this age and generation, as well as in generations of old;
text.zh: 他們向世人證明神聖經文是真實的，神確實像古代那樣，在這時代和世代感召並召喚世人做祂神聖的事工；

text.en: Thereby showing that he is the same God yesterday, today, and forever. Amen.
text.zh: 藉此顯明祂昨天、今天、永遠都是同樣的神。阿們。

text.en: Therefore, having so great witnesses, by them shall the world be judged, even as many as shall hereafter come to a knowledge of this work.
text.zh: 因此，有這麼大的見證後，今後凡知道這事工的世人，都要根據這些見證受審判。

text.en: And those who receive it in faith, and work righteousness, shall receive a crown of eternal life;
text.zh: 那些憑信心接受又行事正義的，必得永生的冠冕；

text.en: But those who harden their hearts in unbelief, and reject it, it shall turn to their own condemnation—
text.zh: 但那些在不信中硬起心來又拒絕的，必使自己定罪——

text.en: For the Lord God has spoken it; and we, the elders of the church, have heard and bear witness to the words of the glorious Majesty on high, to whom be glory forever and ever. Amen.
text.zh: 因為主神已這麼說了，我們，教會的長老們，已聽到並見證高天榮耀的至高者說的話，願榮耀永永遠遠歸給祂。阿們。

text.en: By these things we know that there is a God in heaven, who is infinite and eternal, from everlasting to everlasting the same unchangeable God, the framer of heaven and earth, and all things which are in them;
text.zh: 我們從這些事知道，天上有一位神，祂無限而永恆，從永遠到永遠都是不變的神，是天地和其中萬物的創制主；

text.en: And that he created man, male and female, after his own image and in his own likeness, created he them;
text.zh: 祂創造世人，男的和女的，照自己的形像和樣式造人；

text.en: And gave unto them commandments that they should love and serve him, the only living and true God, and that he should be the only being whom they should worship.
text.zh: 並給他們誡命，要他們愛祂並事奉祂，這唯一活著的真神，祂是他們唯一崇拜的對象。

text.en: But by the transgression of these holy laws man became sensual and devilish, and became fallen man.
text.zh: 但是人因為違反了這些神聖律法，而變成情慾的、魔鬼似的和墜落的人。

text.en: Wherefore, the Almighty God gave his Only Begotten Son, as it is written in those scriptures which have been given of him.
text.zh: 因此，如祂給予的經文所記載的，全能之神給了祂的獨生子。

text.en: He suffered temptations but gave no heed unto them.
text.zh: 祂受試探但不予理會。

text.en: He was crucified, died, and rose again the third day;
text.zh: 祂被釘十字架，死亡，第三天復活；

text.en: And ascended into heaven, to sit down on the right hand of the Father, to reign with almighty power according to the will of the Father;
text.zh: 祂升到天上，坐在父的右邊，按照父的意思，用全能統治；

text.en: That as many as would believe and be baptized in his holy name, and endure in faith to the end, should be saved—
text.zh: 凡相信而奉祂聖名受洗，並憑信心持守到底的，都必得救——

text.en: Not only those who believed after he came in the meridian of time, in the flesh, but all those from the beginning, even as many as were before he came, who believed in the words of the holy prophets, who spake as they were inspired by the gift of the Holy Ghost, who truly testified of him in all things, should have eternal life,
text.zh: 不僅是那些在祂於全盛時期在肉身中來臨後相信的人要得永生，凡從太初到祂來之前就相信聖先知話的，都必得到永生。聖先知受聖靈恩賜感召說話，確實在萬事中為祂作見證，

text.en: As well as those who should come after, who should believe in the gifts and callings of God by the Holy Ghost, which beareth record of the Father and of the Son;
text.zh: 還有那些要在以後來，要憑為父與子作證的聖靈而相信神的恩賜和召喚的，也必得到永生；

text.en: Which Father, Son, and Holy Ghost are one God, infinite and eternal, without end. Amen.
text.zh: 父、子、聖靈是一神，無限而永恆，沒有止境。阿們。

text.en: And we know that all men must repent and believe on the name of Jesus Christ, and worship the Father in his name, and endure in faith on his name to the end, or they cannot be saved in the kingdom of God.
text.zh: 而且我們知道，全人類都必須悔改，信靠耶穌基督的名，奉祂的名崇拜父，在對祂的名的信心中持守到底，否則他們無法在神的國度中得救。

text.en: And we know that justification through the grace of our Lord and Savior Jesus Christ is just and true;
text.zh: 我們知道，靠我們的主和救主耶穌基督的恩典而稱義，是公正而真實的；

text.en: And we know also, that sanctification through the grace of our Lord and Savior Jesus Christ is just and true, to all those who love and serve God with all their mights, minds, and strength.
text.zh: 我們也知道，凡盡能、盡意、盡力愛神並事奉神的人，靠我們的主和救主耶穌基督的恩典而聖化，是公正而真實的。

text.en: But there is a possibility that man may fall from grace and depart from the living God;
text.zh: 但是人也有可能從恩典中墜落而遠離活著的神；

text.en: Therefore let the church take heed and pray always, lest they fall into temptation;
text.zh: 因此教會成員要留意並一直禱告，以免落入誘惑；

text.en: Yea, and even let those who are sanctified take heed also.
text.zh: 是的，甚至那些已聖化的也要留意。

text.en: And we know that these things are true and according to the revelations of John, neither adding to, nor diminishing from the prophecy of his book, the holy scriptures, or the revelations of God which shall come hereafter by the gift and power of the Holy Ghost, the voice of God, or the ministering of angels.
text.zh: 我們知道這些事情是真實的，都符合約翰的啟示，對他書中的預言，神聖的經文，或神的啟示都不加添或刪減；今後神的啟示將藉聖靈的恩賜和力量，神的聲音，或天使的施助而來。

text.en: And the Lord God has spoken it; and honor, power and glory be rendered to his holy name, both now and ever. Amen.
text.zh: 主神已這麼說了；願尊貴、權力、榮耀都歸祂的聖名，從現在直到永遠。阿們。

text.en: And again, by way of commandment to the church concerning the manner of baptism—All those who humble themselves before God, and desire to be baptized, and come forth with broken hearts and contrite spirits, and witness before the church that they have truly repented of all their sins, and are willing to take upon them the name of Jesus Christ, having a determination to serve him to the end, and truly manifest by their works that they have received of the Spirit of Christ unto the remission of their sins, shall be received by baptism into his church.
text.zh: 再者，給予教會有關洗禮方式的誡命——凡在神前謙卑自己，渴望受洗，帶著破碎的心和痛悔的靈前來，在教會成員前證明確實悔改了一切的罪，願意承受耶穌基督的名，決心事奉祂到底，並確實以行為表明已接受基督的靈以獲得他們罪的赦免的人，都應藉著洗禮接納他們加入祂的教會。

text.en: The duty of the elders, priests, teachers, deacons, and members of the church of Christ—An apostle is an elder, and it is his calling to baptize;
text.zh: 基督教會的長老、祭司、教師、執事和成員的職責——使徒是長老，其召喚是施洗，

text.en: And to ordain other elders, priests, teachers, and deacons;
text.zh: 並按立其他長老、祭司、教師和執事；

text.en: And to administer bread and wine—the emblems of the flesh and blood of Christ—
text.zh: 並主理餅和酒——基督的肉和血的象徵——

text.en: And to confirm those who are baptized into the church, by the laying on of hands for the baptism of fire and the Holy Ghost, according to the scriptures;
text.zh: 並根據經文，藉著火與聖靈洗禮的按手禮，證實受洗加入教會的人；

text.en: And to teach, expound, exhort, baptize, and watch over the church;
text.zh: 並教導、講解、勸勉、施洗和看顧教會成員；

text.en: And to confirm the church by the laying on of the hands, and the giving of the Holy Ghost;
text.zh: 並藉按手禮和給予聖靈來證實教會成員；

text.en: And to take the lead of all meetings.
text.zh: 並領導所有的聚會。

text.en: The elders are to conduct the meetings as they are led by the Holy Ghost, according to the commandments and revelations of God.
text.zh: 長老要依照神的誡命和啟示，在聖靈引導下主持聚會。

text.en: The priest’s duty is to preach, teach, expound, exhort, and baptize, and administer the sacrament,
text.zh: 祭司的職責是宣講、教導、講解、勸勉、施洗、主理聖餐，

text.en: And visit the house of each member, and exhort them to pray vocally and in secret and attend to all family duties.
text.zh: 並探訪每位成員的家，勸勉他們出聲和在暗中禱告，並負起一切家庭責任。

text.en: And he may also ordain other priests, teachers, and deacons.
text.zh: 他也可以按立其他祭司、教師和執事。

text.en: And he is to take the lead of meetings when there is no elder present;
text.zh: 若沒有長老在場，他要領導聚會；

text.en: But when there is an elder present, he is only to preach, teach, expound, exhort, and baptize,
text.zh: 但若有長老在場，他就只宣講、教導、講解、勸勉、施洗，

text.en: And visit the house of each member, exhorting them to pray vocally and in secret and attend to all family duties.
text.zh: 並探訪每位成員的家，勸勉他們出聲和在暗中禱告，並負起一切家庭責任。

text.en: In all these duties the priest is to assist the elder if occasion requires.
text.zh: 必要時，祭司要在這所有的職責上協助長老。

text.en: The teacher’s duty is to watch over the church always, and be with and strengthen them;
text.zh: 教師的職責是一直看顧教會成員，和他們在一起，並堅固他們；

text.en: And see that there is no iniquity in the church, neither hardness with each other, neither lying, backbiting, nor evil speaking;
text.zh: 確使教會裡沒有罪惡，沒有冷酷相待，沒有說謊，沒有背後中傷，也沒有邪惡的言談；

text.en: And see that the church meet together often, and also see that all the members do their duty.
text.zh: 確使教會成員時常相聚，確使每位成員各盡其職。

text.en: And he is to take the lead of meetings in the absence of the elder or priest—
text.zh: 若沒有長老或祭司在場，他要領導聚會——

text.en: And is to be assisted always, in all his duties in the church, by the deacons, if occasion requires.
text.zh: 如果情況需要，執事們要一直協助他在教會中的所有的職責。

text.en: But neither teachers nor deacons have authority to baptize, administer the sacrament, or lay on hands;
text.zh: 但是教師和執事都沒有權柄施洗、主理聖餐或按手；

text.en: They are, however, to warn, expound, exhort, and teach, and invite all to come unto Christ.
text.zh: 然而，他們要警告、講解、勸勉、教導，並邀請所有的人歸向基督。

text.en: Every elder, priest, teacher, or deacon is to be ordained according to the gifts and callings of God unto him; and he is to be ordained by the power of the Holy Ghost, which is in the one who ordains him.
text.zh: 每位長老、祭司、教師或執事，都要按照神給他的恩賜和召喚而蒙按立，並且要藉按立者身上的聖靈力量而蒙按立。

text.en: The several elders composing this church of Christ are to meet in conference once in three months, or from time to time as said conferences shall direct or appoint;
text.zh: 組成這基督的教會的幾位長老們，每三個月必須舉行一次大會，或按這大會的指示或規定，不時舉行；

text.en: And said conferences are to do whatever church business is necessary to be done at the time.
text.zh: 這大會應處理當時一切必須處理的教會事務。

text.en: The elders are to receive their licenses from other elders, by vote of the church to which they belong, or from the conferences.
text.zh: 長老須經其所屬分支會表決，從其他長老處獲得證書，或從大會獲得。

text.en: Each priest, teacher, or deacon, who is ordained by a priest, may take a certificate from him at the time, which certificate, when presented to an elder, shall entitle him to a license, which shall authorize him to perform the duties of his calling, or he may receive it from a conference.
text.zh: 每位由祭司按立的祭司、教師或執事，可在當時向該祭司取得證明，向長老出示該證明後，就可獲得證書，這證書授權給他執行召喚中的職責，或者他可以從大會獲得證書。

text.en: No person is to be ordained to any office in this church, where there is a regularly organized branch of the same, without the vote of that church;
text.zh: 在正式成立分會的地方，若無該分會教會成員的表決，任何人不得被按立擔任本教會的任何職位；

text.en: But the presiding elders, traveling bishops, high councilors, high priests, and elders, may have the privilege of ordaining, where there is no branch of the church that a vote may be called.
text.zh: 但在沒有教會的分會，以致無法表決的地方，主領長老、巡迴主教、高級諮議、大祭司以及長老都有執行按立的特權。

text.en: Every president of the high priesthood (or presiding elder), bishop, high councilor, and high priest, is to be ordained by the direction of a high council or general conference.
text.zh: 每位高級聖職的會長（或主領長老）、主教、高級諮議和大祭司，都應在高級諮議會或全體大會的指示下按立。

text.en: The duty of the members after they are received by baptism—The elders or priests are to have a sufficient time to expound all things concerning the church of Christ to their understanding, previous to their partaking of the sacrament and being confirmed by the laying on of the hands of the elders, so that all things may be done in order.
text.zh: 經洗禮被接納後之成員的職責。——在他們領受聖餐並由長老按手證實前，長老或祭司應有充分時間講解基督的教會裡所有的事，使他們了解，好使一切事都依序完成。

text.en: And the members shall manifest before the church, and also before the elders, by a godly walk and conversation, that they are worthy of it, that there may be works and faith agreeable to the holy scriptures—walking in holiness before the Lord.
text.zh: 成員應在其他教會成員和長老面前，以虔敬的言行表現他們配稱，行為、信心都符合神聖經文——在主前聖潔地行走。

text.en: Every member of the church of Christ having children is to bring them unto the elders before the church, who are to lay their hands upon them in the name of Jesus Christ, and bless them in his name.
text.zh: 基督教會中每位有小孩的成員，應在教會成員面前把小孩帶到長老那裡，長老要奉耶穌基督的名按手在小孩頭上，奉祂的名祝福他們。

text.en: No one can be received into the church of Christ unless he has arrived unto the years of accountability before God, and is capable of repentance.
text.zh: 除了到達在神前負責的年齡，並且有能力悔改的人外，不得接受任何人加入基督的教會。

text.en: Baptism is to be administered in the following manner unto all those who repent—
text.zh: 要用以下方式為所有悔改的人執行洗禮——

text.en: The person who is called of God and has authority from Jesus Christ to baptize, shall go down into the water with the person who has presented himself or herself for baptism, and shall say, calling him or her by name: Having been commissioned of Jesus Christ, I baptize you in the name of the Father, and of the Son, and of the Holy Ghost. Amen.
text.zh: 蒙神召喚並有來自耶穌基督的權柄為人施洗者，應和前來受洗的人走進水中，叫他或她的名字，說：我蒙耶穌基督的委派，奉父的，和子的，和聖靈的名，為你施洗。阿們。

text.en: Then shall he immerse him or her in the water, and come forth again out of the water.
text.zh: 然後把他或她浸沒在水中，再從水中出來。

text.en: It is expedient that the church meet together often to partake of bread and wine in the remembrance of the Lord Jesus;
text.zh: 教會成員應常常聚在一起領受餅和酒，記得主耶穌；

text.en: And the elder or priest shall administer it; and after this manner shall he administer it—he shall kneel with the church and call upon the Father in solemn prayer, saying:
text.zh: 長老或祭司應主理此事，他要按此方式來主理——他要與教會成員一同跪下，以莊嚴的祈禱呼求父，說：

text.en: O God, the Eternal Father, we ask thee in the name of thy Son, Jesus Christ, to bless and sanctify this bread to the souls of all those who partake of it, that they may eat in remembrance of the body of thy Son, and witness unto thee, O God, the Eternal Father, that they are willing to take upon them the name of thy Son, and always remember him and keep his commandments which he has given them; that they may always have his Spirit to be with them. Amen.
text.zh: 神啊，永恆的父，我們奉您子耶穌基督的名，祈求您為所有領受此餅之人的靈魂，祝福並聖化此餅，讓他們食用，以記得您子的身體，並向您，神啊，永恆的父，證明他們願意承受您子的名，一直記得祂，並遵守祂賜給他們的誡命，使他們能一直有祂的靈與他們同在。阿們。

text.en: The manner of administering the wine—he shall take the cup also, and say:
text.zh: 主理酒的方式——他也要拿起杯來，說：

text.en: O God, the Eternal Father, we ask thee in the name of thy Son, Jesus Christ, to bless and sanctify this wine to the souls of all those who drink of it, that they may do it in remembrance of the blood of thy Son, which was shed for them; that they may witness unto thee, O God, the Eternal Father, that they do always remember him, that they may have his Spirit to be with them. Amen.
text.zh: 神啊，永恆的父，我們奉您子耶穌基督的名，祈求您為所有飲用此酒之人的靈魂，祝福並聖化此酒，讓他們飲用，以記得您子為他們所流的血；使他們能向您，神啊，永恆的父，證明他們確實一直記得祂，使他們能有祂的靈與他們同在。阿們。

text.en: Any member of the church of Christ transgressing, or being overtaken in a fault, shall be dealt with as the scriptures direct.
text.zh: 基督教會中任何成員違誡，或犯錯被發現，應照經文指示處理。

text.en: It shall be the duty of the several churches, composing the church of Christ, to send one or more of their teachers to attend the several conferences held by the elders of the church,
text.zh: 組成基督教會的各分支會，有責任派遣一位或多位教師，出席教會中長老舉行的各項大會。

text.en: With a list of the names of the several members uniting themselves with the church since the last conference; or send by the hand of some priest; so that a regular list of all the names of the whole church may be kept in a book by one of the elders, whomsoever the other elders shall appoint from time to time;
text.zh: 帶著一份自上次大會以來加入教會的成員名單；或由某位祭司親自送去；這樣全體教會成員的正式名單，就可由一位長老保存在簿冊中，該長老是由其他長老隨時指派；

text.en: And also, if any have been expelled from the church, so that their names may be blotted out of the general church record of names.
text.zh: 還有，如果任何成員被教會開除，這樣他們的名字就可從教會的總名冊中刪除。

text.en: All members removing from the church where they reside, if going to a church where they are not known, may take a letter certifying that they are regular members and in good standing, which certificate may be signed by any elder or priest if the member receiving the letter is personally acquainted with the elder or priest, or it may be signed by the teachers or deacons of the church.
text.zh: 凡從原居住地區分支會遷出的成員，若遷往不認識他們的分支會，可持一封信證明他們為正規成員並具有良好品行；成員可請熟識的長老或祭司簽發該證明信，或由該分支會的教師或執事簽發。

introduction.en: Revelation given to Joseph Smith the Prophet, at Fayette, New York, April 6, 1830. This revelation was given at the organization of the Church, on the date named, in the home of Peter Whitmer Sr. Six men, who had previously been baptized, participated. By unanimous vote these persons expressed their desire and determination to organize, according to the commandment of God (see section 20). They also voted to accept and sustain Joseph Smith Jr. and Oliver Cowdery as the presiding officers of the Church. With the laying on of hands, Joseph then ordained Oliver an elder of the Church, and Oliver similarly ordained Joseph. After administration of the sacrament, Joseph and Oliver laid hands upon the participants individually for the bestowal of the Holy Ghost and for the confirmation of each as a member of the Church.

text.en: –3, Joseph Smith is called to be a seer, translator, prophet, apostle, and elder; 4–8, His word will guide the cause of Zion; 9–12, The Saints will believe his words as he speaks by the Comforter.
text.zh: 年4月6日，在紐約，菲也特，給予先知約瑟·斯密的啟示。這啟示是上述日期在老彼得·惠特茂家組織教會時給予的。當時有六位已受洗的人參與。他們以一致贊成表明他們的渴望和決心，要遵照神的誡命來組織教會（見第20篇）。他們也表決通過，接受並支持小約瑟·斯密和奧利佛·考德里為教會主領職員。然後約瑟以按手禮按立奧利佛為教會的長老；奧利佛也同樣按立了約瑟。主理聖餐後，約瑟和奧利佛一一按手在與會者頭上，賜予聖靈並證實每人為教會的成員。

text.en: Behold, there shall be a record kept among you; and in it thou shalt be called a seer, a translator, a prophet, an apostle of Jesus Christ, an elder of the church through the will of God the Father, and the grace of your Lord Jesus Christ,
text.zh: -3，約瑟·斯密蒙召為先見、翻譯者、先知、使徒和長老；4-8，他的話會指導錫安偉業；9-12，聖徒們會相信他藉保惠師說的話。

text.en: Being inspired of the Holy Ghost to lay the foundation thereof, and to build it up unto the most holy faith.
text.zh: 看啊，在你們中間要保存紀錄；由於父神的旨意和你主耶穌基督的恩典，在紀錄中你要被稱為先見、翻譯者、先知、耶穌基督的使徒、教會的長老，

text.en: Which church was organized and established in the year of your Lord eighteen hundred and thirty, in the fourth month, and on the sixth day of the month which is called April.
text.zh: 在聖靈感召下奠定教會的基礎，為至聖的真道把教會建立起來。

text.en: Wherefore, meaning the church, thou shalt give heed unto all his words and commandments which he shall give unto you as he receiveth them, walking in all holiness before me;
text.zh: 這教會組織成立於主曆一千八百三十年第四個月，即四月的第六日。

text.en: For his word ye shall receive, as if from mine own mouth, in all patience and faith.
text.zh: 因此，你們，即教會成員們，要聽從他在完全聖潔地行走在我面前時所接受並給予你們的一切話語和誡命；

text.en: For by doing these things the gates of hell shall not prevail against you; yea, and the Lord God will disperse the powers of darkness from before you, and cause the heavens to shake for your good, and his name’s glory.
text.zh: 你們要用一切耐心和信心接受他的話，就像從我口中接受一樣。

text.en: For thus saith the Lord God: Him have I inspired to move the cause of Zion in mighty power for good, and his diligence I know, and his prayers I have heard.
text.zh: 因為這麼做，地獄的門必不能勝過你們；是的，主神要從你們面前驅散黑暗的力量，並使諸天為你們的益處和祂名的榮耀而震動。

text.en: Yea, his weeping for Zion I have seen, and I will cause that he shall mourn for her no longer; for his days of rejoicing are come unto the remission of his sins, and the manifestations of my blessings upon his works.
text.zh: 因為主神這樣說：為了有益的目的，我已感召他以強大的能力推動錫安偉業，他的努力我知道，他的禱告我也聽到。

text.en: For, behold, I will bless all those who labor in my vineyard with a mighty blessing, and they shall believe on his words, which are given him through me by the Comforter, which manifesteth that Jesus was crucified by sinful men for the sins of the world, yea, for the remission of sins unto the contrite heart.
text.zh: 是的，他為錫安哭泣我看到，我要使他不再為她哀傷；他快樂的日子到了，因為他要獲得赦罪，而且我的祝福會顯示在他的行為上。

text.en: Wherefore it behooveth me that he should be ordained by you, Oliver Cowdery mine apostle;
text.zh: 因為，看啊，凡在我葡萄園裡工作的人，我要以極大的祝福來祝福他們，他們將相信透過我藉保惠師給予他的話，那保惠師顯示耶穌為了世人的罪而被罪人釘在十字架上，是的，為了痛悔之心的赦罪而被釘十字架。

text.en: This being an ordinance unto you, that you are an elder under his hand, he being the first unto you, that you might be an elder unto this church of Christ, bearing my name—
text.zh: 因此，我的使徒奧利佛·考德里，他由你來按立，對我來說是必要的；

text.en: And the first preacher of this church unto the church, and before the world, yea, before the Gentiles; yea, and thus saith the Lord God, lo, lo! to the Jews also. Amen.
text.zh: 這教儀是為了你，你是他按手之下的長老，他對你來說是第一位長老，使你能成為承受我名的基督教會的長老——

introduction.en: Revelation given through Joseph Smith the Prophet, at Manchester, New York, April 16, 1830. This revelation was given to the Church in consequence of some who had previously been baptized desiring to unite with the Church without rebaptism.

text.en: , Baptism is a new and everlasting covenant; 2–4, Authoritative baptism is required.
text.zh: 年4月16日，在紐約，曼徹斯特，透過先知約瑟·斯密給予的啟示。給予教會這啟示，是由於幾位以前曾受洗的人，想不再受洗而加入教會。

text.en: Behold, I say unto you that all old covenants have I caused to be done away in this thing; and this is a new and an everlasting covenant, even that which was from the beginning.
text.zh: ，洗禮是一條新永約；2-4，授權的洗禮是必要的。

text.en: Wherefore, although a man should be baptized an hundred times it availeth him nothing, for you cannot enter in at the strait gate by the law of Moses, neither by your dead works.
text.zh: 看啊，我告訴你們，藉著這件事，一切舊的聖約我都廢除了；這是一條新而永久的聖約，從太初就有的。

text.en: For it is because of your dead works that I have caused this last covenant and this church to be built up unto me, even as in days of old.
text.zh: 因此，即使一個人受洗一百次，對他也毫無用處，因為你們既不能靠摩西律法也不能靠死的行為進入窄門。

text.en: Wherefore, enter ye in at the gate, as I have commanded, and seek not to counsel your God. Amen.
text.zh: 就是由於你們死的行為，我才使這最後的聖約和這教會像古代那樣為我建立起來。

introduction.en: A series of five revelations given through Joseph Smith the Prophet, at Manchester, New York, April 1830, to Oliver Cowdery, Hyrum Smith, Samuel H. Smith, Joseph Smith Sr., and Joseph Knight Sr. As the result of earnest desire on the part of the five persons named to know of their respective duties, the Prophet inquired of the Lord and received a revelation for each person.

text.en: –7, These early disciples are called to preach, exhort, and strengthen the Church.
text.zh: 年4月，在紐約，曼徹斯特，透過先知約瑟·斯密給予奧利佛·考德里、海侖·斯密、撒母耳·斯密、老約瑟·斯密及老約瑟·耐特的接連五則啟示。由於前述五人熱切渴望知道各自的職責，先知求問主並為每個人獲得一則啟示。

text.en: Behold, I speak unto you, Oliver, a few words. Behold, thou art blessed, and art under no condemnation. But beware of pride, lest thou shouldst enter into temptation.
text.zh: -7，這些早期的門徒蒙召喚宣講、勸勉並堅固教會成員。

text.en: Make known thy calling unto the church, and also before the world, and thy heart shall be opened to preach the truth from henceforth and forever. Amen.
text.zh: 看啊，奧利佛，我對你說幾句話。看啊，你是蒙福的，而且沒被定罪。但是要慎防驕傲，免得入了迷惑。

text.en: Behold, I speak unto you, Hyrum, a few words; for thou also art under no condemnation, and thy heart is opened, and thy tongue loosed; and thy calling is to exhortation, and to strengthen the church continually. Wherefore thy duty is unto the church forever, and this because of thy family. Amen.
text.zh: 讓教會成員和世人知道你的召喚；你的心將被打開，去宣講真理，從今直到永遠。阿們。

text.en: Behold, I speak a few words unto you, Samuel; for thou also art under no condemnation, and thy calling is to exhortation, and to strengthen the church; and thou art not as yet called to preach before the world. Amen.
text.zh: 看啊，海侖，我對你說幾句話；你也沒被定罪；你的心已打開，你的舌已鬆開；你的召喚是勸勉和不斷地堅固教會成員。因此你的職責永遠是對教會的，這是因為你家庭的緣故。阿們。

text.en: Behold, I speak a few words unto you, Joseph; for thou also art under no condemnation, and thy calling also is to exhortation, and to strengthen the church; and this is thy duty from henceforth and forever. Amen.
text.zh: 看啊，撒母耳，我對你說幾句話；你也沒被定罪，你的召喚是勸勉和堅固教會成員；你還未被召喚向世人宣講。阿們。

text.en: Behold, I manifest unto you, Joseph Knight, by these words, that you must take up your cross, in the which you must pray vocally before the world as well as in secret, and in your family, and among your friends, and in all places.
text.zh: 看啊，約瑟，我對你說幾句話；你也沒被定罪，你的召喚也是勸勉和堅固教會成員；這是你的職責，從今直到永遠。阿們。

text.en: And, behold, it is your duty to unite with the true church, and give your language to exhortation continually, that you may receive the reward of the laborer. Amen.
text.zh: 看啊，約瑟·耐特，我藉這些話向你顯示，你必須背起你的十字架，你必須在世人面前出聲禱告，也要在暗中禱告，還要在家中、在朋友之間，以及在所有地方禱告。

introduction.en: Revelation given to Joseph Smith the Prophet and Oliver Cowdery, at Harmony, Pennsylvania, July 1830. Though less than four months had elapsed since the Church was organized, persecution had become intense, and the leaders had to seek safety in partial seclusion. The following three revelations were given at this time to strengthen, encourage, and instruct them.

text.en: –9, Joseph Smith is called to translate, preach, and expound scriptures; 10–12, Oliver Cowdery is called to preach the gospel; 13–19, The law is revealed relative to miracles, cursings, casting off the dust of one’s feet, and going without purse or scrip.
text.zh: 年7月，在賓夕法尼亞，哈茂耐，給予先知約瑟·斯密和奧利佛·考德里的啟示。雖然教會成立不滿四個月，但迫害已很嚴重，為求安全，領袖們不得不半隱居起來。以下三篇啟示是當時為了堅固、鼓勵和指導他們而給予的。

text.en: Behold, thou wast called and chosen to write the Book of Mormon, and to my ministry; and I have lifted thee up out of thine afflictions, and have counseled thee, that thou hast been delivered from all thine enemies, and thou hast been delivered from the powers of Satan and from darkness!
text.zh: -9，約瑟·斯密蒙召喚翻譯、宣講和講解經文；10-12，奧利佛·考德里蒙召喚宣講福音；13-19，透露有關奇蹟、詛罰、跺下腳上塵土以及出去不帶錢囊或口袋的律法。

text.en: Nevertheless, thou art not excusable in thy transgressions; nevertheless, go thy way and sin no more.
text.zh: 看啊，你蒙召喚並揀選來寫《摩爾門經》和做我的事工；我已將你從苦難中提出來，並勸告過你，以解救你脫離所有的敵人，也解救你脫離撒但的力量和黑暗！

text.en: Magnify thine office; and after thou hast sowed thy fields and secured them, go speedily unto the church which is in Colesville, Fayette, and Manchester, and they shall support thee; and I will bless them both spiritually and temporally;
text.zh: 然而，你的違誡還是無可推諉的；然而，去吧，別再犯罪。

text.en: But if they receive thee not, I will send upon them a cursing instead of a blessing.
text.zh: 光大你的職務；你種了田並安頓好以後，就迅速前往考斯威爾、菲也特和曼徹斯特的教會，他們會支持你；我要在屬靈和屬世兩方面祝福他們；

text.en: And thou shalt continue in calling upon God in my name, and writing the things which shall be given thee by the Comforter, and expounding all scriptures unto the church.
text.zh: 但是如果他們不接待你，我要給他們咒詛而非祝福。

text.en: And it shall be given thee in the very moment what thou shalt speak and write, and they shall hear it, or I will send unto them a cursing instead of a blessing.
text.zh: 你要繼續奉我的名呼求神，寫下藉保惠師給你的話，並為教會成員講解所有的經文。

text.en: For thou shalt devote all thy service in Zion; and in this thou shalt have strength.
text.zh: 你要說和寫的話，會在當時給你，他們要聽那些話，否則我要給他們咒詛而非祝福。

text.en: Be patient in afflictions, for thou shalt have many; but endure them, for, lo, I am with thee, even unto the end of thy days.
text.zh: 因為你要把所有的服務貢獻給錫安；在這方面，你將有力量。

text.en: And in temporal labors thou shalt not have strength, for this is not thy calling. Attend to thy calling and thou shalt have wherewith to magnify thine office, and to expound all scriptures, and continue in laying on of the hands and confirming the churches.
text.zh: 在苦難中要忍耐，因為你會有許多苦難；但是要堅忍，因為，看啊，我與你同在，直到你日子的結束。

text.en: And thy brother Oliver shall continue in bearing my name before the world, and also to the church. And he shall not suppose that he can say enough in my cause; and lo, I am with him to the end.
text.zh: 你在屬世工作上不會有力量，因為這不是你的召喚。專注你的召喚，你就能獲得所需的來光大你的職務，講解所有的經文，並繼續行按手禮和證實教會成員。

text.en: In me he shall have glory, and not of himself, whether in weakness or in strength, whether in bonds or free;
text.zh: 你的弟兄奧利佛要繼續向世人，也向教會成員，宣揚我的名。他不要以為能為我的事工說足夠的話；看啊，我與他同在，一直到底。

text.en: And at all times, and in all places, he shall open his mouth and declare my gospel as with the voice of a trump, both day and night. And I will give unto him strength such as is not known among men.
text.zh: 無論軟弱或堅強，無論束縛或自由，他都會因我得榮耀，不是因他自己。

text.en: Require not miracles, except I shall command you, except casting out devils, healing the sick, and against poisonous serpents, and against deadly poisons;
text.zh: 他隨時隨地，不分晝夜，都要張開口，用號角般的聲音宣講我的福音。我要給他世人所不知道的力量。

text.en: And these things ye shall not do, except it be required of you by them who desire it, that the scriptures might be fulfilled; for ye shall do according to that which is written.
text.zh: 除了趕鬼、治病、抗拒毒蛇和抵抗致命之毒以外，若沒有我的命令，不可要求奇蹟；

text.en: And in whatsoever place ye shall enter, and they receive you not in my name, ye shall leave a cursing instead of a blessing, by casting off the dust of your feet against them as a testimony, and cleansing your feet by the wayside.
text.zh: 除非想要這些事的人求你們這麼做，你們不可做這些事，好使經文應驗；因為你們要按照記載行事。

text.en: And it shall come to pass that whosoever shall lay their hands upon you by violence, ye shall command to be smitten in my name; and, behold, I will smite them according to your words, in mine own due time.
text.zh: 無論你們進入何處，他們不因我的名接待你們，你們就跺下腳上的塵土，見證他們的不是，並在路旁潔淨你們的腳，留下詛咒而非祝福。

text.en: And whosoever shall go to law with thee shall be cursed by the law.
text.zh: 事情將是這樣，無論誰用暴力對待你們，你們就要奉我的名命令誰受擊打；看啊，我必按照你們的話，在我認為適當的時刻，擊打他們。

text.en: And thou shalt take no purse nor scrip, neither staves, neither two coats, for the church shall give unto thee in the very hour what thou needest for food and for raiment, and for shoes and for money, and for scrip.
text.zh: 無論誰對你訴諸法律，誰就會受法律的詛咒。

text.en: For thou art called to prune my vineyard with a mighty pruning, yea, even for the last time; yea, and also all those whom thou hast ordained, and they shall do even according to this pattern. Amen.
text.zh: 你不要帶錢囊或口袋，不要帶拐杖，也不要帶兩件外衣，因為你需要的食物、衣服、鞋子、金錢和口袋，教會成員們會在你正需要的時候給你。

introduction.en: Revelation given through Joseph Smith the Prophet, at Harmony, Pennsylvania, July 1830 (see the heading to section 24). This revelation manifests the will of the Lord to Emma Smith, the Prophet’s wife.

text.en: –6, Emma Smith, an elect lady, is called to aid and comfort her husband; 7–11, She is also called to write, to expound scriptures, and to select hymns; 12–14, The song of the righteous is a prayer unto the Lord; 15–16, Principles of obedience in this revelation are applicable to all.
text.zh: 年7月，在賓夕法尼亞，哈茂耐，透過先知約瑟·斯密給予的啟示（見第24篇前言）。這啟示顯明主對先知的妻子愛瑪·斯密的旨意。

text.en: Hearken unto the voice of the Lord your God, while I speak unto you, Emma Smith, my daughter; for verily I say unto you, all those who receive my gospel are sons and daughters in my kingdom.
text.zh: -6，愛瑪·斯密，一位蒙揀選的女子，被召喚幫助並安慰其丈夫；7-11，她還被召喚抄寫紀錄，講解經文並選擇聖詩；12-14，義人的歌唱就是對主的祈禱；15-16，這啟示中的服從原則適用於所有的人。

text.en: A revelation I give unto you concerning my will; and if thou art faithful and walk in the paths of virtue before me, I will preserve thy life, and thou shalt receive an inheritance in Zion.
text.zh: 我的女兒愛瑪·斯密，我對你講話時，要聽你主神的聲音；因為，我實在告訴你，凡接受我福音的人，都是我國度中的兒女。

text.en: Behold, thy sins are forgiven thee, and thou art an elect lady, whom I have called.
text.zh: 我給你一個關於我旨意的啟示；如果你忠信，並在我面前行走在美德之道上，我必保全你的生命，而你必在錫安得到產業。

text.en: Murmur not because of the things which thou hast not seen, for they are withheld from thee and from the world, which is wisdom in me in a time to come.
text.zh: 看啊，你的罪赦了，你是一位我所召喚的，蒙揀選的女子。

text.en: And the office of thy calling shall be for a comfort unto my servant, Joseph Smith, Jun., thy husband, in his afflictions, with consoling words, in the spirit of meekness.
text.zh: 不要為你沒有看到的事物抱怨，因為那些事物不讓你和世人看到，是我在未來時期的智慧。

text.en: And thou shalt go with him at the time of his going, and be unto him for a scribe, while there is no one to be a scribe for him, that I may send my servant, Oliver Cowdery, whithersoever I will.
text.zh: 你蒙召喚的職責是以安慰的言語、溫順的態度，在我僕人小約瑟·斯密，亦即你丈夫痛苦時安慰他。

text.en: And thou shalt be ordained under his hand to expound scriptures, and to exhort the church, according as it shall be given thee by my Spirit.
text.zh: 他走時你要跟他一起走，沒有人作他的抄寫員時，你要作他的抄寫員，這樣我好派我僕人奧利佛·考德里，到我要他去的任何地方。

text.en: For he shall lay his hands upon thee, and thou shalt receive the Holy Ghost, and thy time shall be given to writing, and to learning much.
text.zh: 你要由他的手按立，按照我的靈給你的那樣，講解經文，勸勉教會成員。

text.en: And thou needest not fear, for thy husband shall support thee in the church; for unto them is his calling, that all things might be revealed unto them, whatsoever I will, according to their faith.
text.zh: 因為他將按手在你頭上，你將接受聖靈，你的時間要用來抄寫和多多學習。

text.en: And verily I say unto thee that thou shalt lay aside the things of this world, and seek for the things of a better.
text.zh: 你不用害怕，因為你丈夫將在教會中支持你；因為他是為他們而被召喚的，好使我要顯示的一切，都能按照他們的信心向他們顯示。

text.en: And it shall be given thee, also, to make a selection of sacred hymns, as it shall be given thee, which is pleasing unto me, to be had in my church.
text.zh: 我實在告訴你，你要把這世上的事放在一邊，追求一個較好世界的事。

text.en: For my soul delighteth in the song of the heart; yea, the song of the righteous is a prayer unto me, and it shall be answered with a blessing upon their heads.
text.zh: 此外，將要指示你，照那將給你的指示，製作一本我所喜悅的聖詩選輯，供我教會使用。

text.en: Wherefore, lift up thy heart and rejoice, and cleave unto the covenants which thou hast made.
text.zh: 因為，我的靈魂喜愛發自內心的歌唱；是的，義人的歌唱就是對我的祈禱，必有祝福加在他們頭上作為答覆。

text.en: Continue in the spirit of meekness, and beware of pride. Let thy soul delight in thy husband, and the glory which shall come upon him.
text.zh: 因此，要滿懷喜樂，並固守你立的聖約。

text.en: Keep my commandments continually, and a crown of righteousness thou shalt receive. And except thou do this, where I am you cannot come.
text.zh: 保持溫順的態度，慎防驕傲。讓你的靈魂因你丈夫和那將給予他的榮耀而喜悅。

text.en: And verily, verily, I say unto you, that this is my voice unto all. Amen.
text.zh: 不斷遵守我的誡命，這樣你必得到正義的冠冕。除非你這麼做，否則我所在的地方你不能到。

introduction.en: Revelation given to Joseph Smith the Prophet, Oliver Cowdery, and John Whitmer, at Harmony, Pennsylvania, July 1830 (see the heading to section 24).

text.en: , They are instructed to study the scriptures and to preach; 2, The law of common consent is affirmed.
text.zh: 年7月，在賓夕法尼亞，哈茂耐，給先知約瑟·斯密、奧利佛·考德里和約翰·惠特茂的啟示（見第24篇前言）。

text.en: Behold, I say unto you that you shall let your time be devoted to the studying of the scriptures, and to preaching, and to confirming the church at Colesville, and to performing your labors on the land, such as is required, until after you shall go to the west to hold the next conference; and then it shall be made known what you shall do.
text.zh: ，指示他們要研讀經文和宣講；2，確定一致同意的律法。

text.en: And all things shall be done by common consent in the church, by much prayer and faith, for all things you shall receive by faith. Amen.
text.zh: 看啊，我告訴你們，你們要把時間專用於研讀經文、宣講，並堅固在考斯威爾的教會，必要時，到田裡去工作，直到你們去西部舉行下次大會；那時會使你們知道該做什麼。

introduction.en: Revelation given to Joseph Smith the Prophet, at Harmony, Pennsylvania, August 1830. In preparation for a religious service at which the sacrament of bread and wine was to be administered, Joseph set out to procure wine. He was met by a heavenly messenger and received this revelation, a portion of which was written at the time and the remainder in the September following. Water is now used instead of wine in the sacramental services of the Church.

text.en: –4, The emblems to be used in partaking of the sacrament are set forth; 5–14, Christ and His servants from all dispensations are to partake of the sacrament; 15–18, Put on the whole armor of God.
text.zh: 年8月，在賓夕法尼亞，哈茂耐，給先知約瑟·斯密的啟示。約瑟外出買酒，在準備宗教儀式來主理餅和酒的聖餐時，遇到一位天上的使者，而獲得本啟示；其中一部分是當時寫的，其餘是在接下來的9月寫的。現在教會的聖餐儀式中，都以水代酒。

text.en: Listen to the voice of Jesus Christ, your Lord, your God, and your Redeemer, whose word is quick and powerful.
text.zh: -4，宣布領受聖餐時採用的表徵；5-14，基督和祂每個福音期的僕人們要領受聖餐；15-18，穿上神的全副軍裝。

text.en: For, behold, I say unto you, that it mattereth not what ye shall eat or what ye shall drink when ye partake of the sacrament, if it so be that ye do it with an eye single to my glory—remembering unto the Father my body which was laid down for you, and my blood which was shed for the remission of your sins.
text.zh: 聽你的主，你的神和你的救贖主耶穌基督的聲音，祂的話生動而有力。

text.en: Wherefore, a commandment I give unto you, that you shall not purchase wine neither strong drink of your enemies;
text.zh: 因為，看啊，我告訴你，你們領受聖餐時，如果將眼睛專注於我的榮耀——在父面前記得我為你們捨的身體，和我為赦免你們的罪而流的血——你們吃什麼或喝什麼都沒有關係。

text.en: Wherefore, you shall partake of none except it is made new among you; yea, in this my Father’s kingdom which shall be built up on the earth.
text.zh: 因此，我給你們一條誡命，你們不可買敵人的酒或烈性飲料；

text.en: Behold, this is wisdom in me; wherefore, marvel not, for the hour cometh that I will drink of the fruit of the vine with you on the earth, and with Moroni, whom I have sent unto you to reveal the Book of Mormon, containing the fulness of my everlasting gospel, to whom I have committed the keys of the record of the stick of Ephraim;
text.zh: 因此，在這我父將在世上建立的國度中，除了你們自己新釀的以外，什麼你都不可領受。

text.en: And also with Elias, to whom I have committed the keys of bringing to pass the restoration of all things spoken by the mouth of all the holy prophets since the world began, concerning the last days;
text.zh: 看啊，這是我的智慧；因此，不要覺得奇怪，因為時候到了，我要在世上與你共飲葡萄汁，也要與摩羅乃共飲，我曾差他到你那裡，顯示包含我圓滿的永久福音的《摩爾門經》，我已把以法蓮杖之紀錄的權鑰交托給他；

text.en: And also John the son of Zacharias, which Zacharias he (Elias) visited and gave promise that he should have a son, and his name should be John, and he should be filled with the spirit of Elias;
text.zh: 我也要與以利亞共飲，我已交托他創世以來所有聖先知說的，有關末世時代促成萬事復興的權鑰；

text.en: Which John I have sent unto you, my servants, Joseph Smith, Jun., and Oliver Cowdery, to ordain you unto the first priesthood which you have received, that you might be called and ordained even as Aaron;
text.zh: 也要與撒迦利亞的兒子約翰共飲，他（以利亞）曾訪問這位撒迦利亞，應許他將有一個兒子，當取名叫約翰，約翰將充滿以利亞的靈；

text.en: And also Elijah, unto whom I have committed the keys of the power of turning the hearts of the fathers to the children, and the hearts of the children to the fathers, that the whole earth may not be smitten with a curse;
text.zh: 我曾差遣這位約翰到你們那裡，即我僕人小約瑟·斯密和奧利佛·考德里那裡，按立你們初級聖職，你們已接受那聖職，好使你們像亞倫那樣蒙召喚和按立；

text.en: And also with Joseph and Jacob, and Isaac, and Abraham, your fathers, by whom the promises remain;
text.zh: 也要與以來加共飲，我已交托他能力的權鑰，將父親的心轉向兒女、兒女的心轉向父親，免得大地遭受詛罰；

text.en: And also with Michael, or Adam, the father of all, the prince of all, the ancient of days;
text.zh: 也要與你們的祖先約瑟、雅各、以撒和亞伯拉罕共飲，藉著他們，應許才得以存留；

text.en: And also with Peter, and James, and John, whom I have sent unto you, by whom I have ordained you and confirmed you to be apostles, and especial witnesses of my name, and bear the keys of your ministry and of the same things which I revealed unto them;
text.zh: 也要與米迦勒，即亞當，眾生之父，眾生之君，亙古常在者共飲；

text.en: Unto whom I have committed the keys of my kingdom, and a dispensation of the gospel for the last times; and for the fulness of times, in the which I will gather together in one all things, both which are in heaven, and which are on earth;
text.zh: 也要與彼得、雅各、約翰共飲，我曾差遣他們到你們那裡，按立並證實你們為使徒，作我名字的特別證人，並持有你們的事工和我顯示給他們的同樣事情的權鑰；

text.en: And also with all those whom my Father hath given me out of the world.
text.zh: 我已交給他們我國度的權鑰和最後的福音期；時間屆滿的時候，我要將天上和地上的一切合而為一；

text.en: Wherefore, lift up your hearts and rejoice, and gird up your loins, and take upon you my whole armor, that ye may be able to withstand the evil day, having done all, that ye may be able to stand.
text.zh: 也要與我父從世上賜給我的人共飲。

text.en: Stand, therefore, having your loins girt about with truth, having on the breastplate of righteousness, and your feet shod with the preparation of the gospel of peace, which I have sent mine angels to commit unto you;
text.zh: 因此，你們要滿懷喜樂，束緊你們的腰，穿戴我的全副軍裝，使你們經得起磨難的日子，並使你們做了這一切後，還能站立得住。

text.en: Taking the shield of faith wherewith ye shall be able to quench all the fiery darts of the wicked;
text.zh: 所以，要站穩，用真理束腰，用正義護胸，腳上穿著平安福音的準備，這福音我已派天使交托你們；

text.en: And take the helmet of salvation, and the sword of my Spirit, which I will pour out upon you, and my word which I reveal unto you, and be agreed as touching all things whatsoever ye ask of me, and be faithful until I come, and ye shall be caught up, that where I am ye shall be also. Amen.
text.zh: 拿起信心的盾牌，使你能熄滅惡人一切帶火的箭；

introduction.en: Revelation given through Joseph Smith the Prophet to Oliver Cowdery, at Fayette, New York, September 1830. Hiram Page, a member of the Church, had a certain stone and professed to be receiving revelations by its aid concerning the upbuilding of Zion and the order of the Church. Several members had been deceived by these claims, and even Oliver Cowdery was wrongly influenced thereby. Just prior to an appointed conference, the Prophet inquired earnestly of the Lord concerning the matter, and this revelation followed.

text.en: –7, Joseph Smith holds the keys of the mysteries, and only he receives revelations for the Church; 8–10, Oliver Cowdery is to preach to the Lamanites; 11–16, Satan deceived Hiram Page and gave him false revelations.
text.zh: 年9月，在紐約，菲也特，透過先知約瑟·斯密給予奧利佛·考德里的啟示。教會成員亥倫·裴治有一塊石頭，他宣稱已藉該石頭得到有關建立錫安和教會體制的啟示。若干成員為此言論所欺，甚至奧利佛·考德里也受到錯誤影響。先知在一次預定的大會開會前，就此事懇切求問主，此啟示隨之而來。

text.en: Behold, I say unto thee, Oliver, that it shall be given unto thee that thou shalt be heard by the church in all things whatsoever thou shalt teach them by the Comforter, concerning the revelations and commandments which I have given.
text.zh: -7，約瑟·斯密持有奧祕之權鑰，是唯一代表教會接受啟示的人；8-10，奧利佛·考德里要向拉曼人傳教；11-16，撒但欺騙亥倫·裴治，給他假啟示。

text.en: But, behold, verily, verily, I say unto thee, no one shall be appointed to receive commandments and revelations in this church excepting my servant Joseph Smith, Jun., for he receiveth them even as Moses.
text.zh: 看啊，奧利佛，我告訴你，我必給你，教會成員必須傾聽你藉保惠師教導他們一切我給予的啟示和誡命。

text.en: And thou shalt be obedient unto the things which I shall give unto him, even as Aaron, to declare faithfully the commandments and the revelations, with power and authority unto the church.
text.zh: 但是，看啊，我實實在在告訴你，除了我僕人小約瑟·斯密外，這教會沒有人被委派接受誡命和啟示，因為他就像摩西那樣接受誡命和啟示。

text.en: And if thou art led at any time by the Comforter to speak or teach, or at all times by the way of commandment unto the church, thou mayest do it.
text.zh: 你要服從我給予他的事，就像亞倫那樣，藉能力和權柄，忠實地向教會成員們宣講誡命和啟示。

text.en: But thou shalt not write by way of commandment, but by wisdom;
text.zh: 無論何時，如果你受保惠師引導去宣講或教導，或在任何時候，用誡命的方式對教會成員宣講或教導，你都可以去做。

text.en: And thou shalt not command him who is at thy head, and at the head of the church;
text.zh: 但你不可用誡命的方式來寫，只能用智慧；

text.en: For I have given him the keys of the mysteries, and the revelations which are sealed, until I shall appoint unto them another in his stead.
text.zh: 你不可命令他，他是你的領袖和教會的領袖；

text.en: And now, behold, I say unto you that you shall go unto the Lamanites and preach my gospel unto them; and inasmuch as they receive thy teachings thou shalt cause my church to be established among them; and thou shalt have revelations, but write them not by way of commandment.
text.zh: 因為我已給他奧祕之權鑰和封住的啟示，直到我委派另一人來接替他。

text.en: And now, behold, I say unto you that it is not revealed, and no man knoweth where the city Zion shall be built, but it shall be given hereafter. Behold, I say unto you that it shall be on the borders by the Lamanites.
text.zh: 現在，看啊，我告訴你，你要到拉曼人那裡向他們宣講我的福音；只要他們接受你的教導，你就要使我的教會在他們中間建立起來；你將獲得啟示，但不可用誡命的方式來寫。

text.en: Thou shalt not leave this place until after the conference; and my servant Joseph shall be appointed to preside over the conference by the voice of it, and what he saith to thee thou shalt tell.
text.zh: 現在，看啊，我告訴你，錫安城要建在哪裡，還沒有顯示，也沒有人知道，但以後會顯示。看啊，我告訴你，那將在拉曼人的邊界上。

text.en: And again, thou shalt take thy brother, Hiram Page, between him and thee alone, and tell him that those things which he hath written from that stone are not of me and that Satan deceiveth him;
text.zh: 大會結束以前你不可離開此地；我僕人約瑟將在大會同意下受委派主領大會，你要講述他對你說的話。

text.en: For, behold, these things have not been appointed unto him, neither shall anything be appointed unto any of this church contrary to the church covenants.
text.zh: 還有，你要帶你的弟兄亥倫·裴治單獨和你在一起，告訴他，他藉石頭寫下來的那些事不是我的，而撒但欺騙了他；

text.en: For all things must be done in order, and by common consent in the church, by the prayer of faith.
text.zh: 因為，看啊，這些事沒有任命給他，任何違反教會聖約的事都不會任命給教會中的任何人。

text.en: And thou shalt assist to settle all these things, according to the covenants of the church, before thou shalt take thy journey among the Lamanites.
text.zh: 因為所有的事都必須藉信心的禱告，並在教會成員一致同意下，按秩序完成。

text.en: And it shall be given thee from the time thou shalt go, until the time thou shalt return, what thou shalt do.
text.zh: 你出發到拉曼人那裡去之前，要按照教會的聖約，協助解決這一切的事。

text.en: And thou must open thy mouth at all times, declaring my gospel with the sound of rejoicing. Amen.
text.zh: 從你出發到回來這段時間，你該做的事我會告訴你。

introduction.en: Revelation given through Joseph Smith the Prophet, in the presence of six elders, at Fayette, New York, September 1830. This revelation was given some days prior to the conference, beginning September 26, 1830.

text.en: –8, Christ gathers His elect; 9–11, His coming ushers in the Millennium; 12–13, The Twelve will judge all Israel; 14–21, Signs, plagues, and desolations will precede the Second Coming; 22–28, The last resurrection and final judgment follow the Millennium; 29–35, All things are spiritual unto the Lord; 36–39, The devil and his hosts were cast out of heaven to tempt man; 40–45, The Fall and Atonement bring salvation; 46–50, Little children are redeemed through the Atonement.
text.zh: 年9月，在紐約，菲也特，在六位長老面前，透過先知約瑟·斯密給予的啟示。這啟示是1830年9月26日大會開始前幾天給予的。

text.en: Listen to the voice of Jesus Christ, your Redeemer, the Great I Am, whose arm of mercy hath atoned for your sins;
text.zh: -8，基督聚集祂的選民；9-11，祂的來臨開啟千禧年；12-13，十二位會審判全以色列；14-21，第二次來臨之前將有預兆、瘟疫、荒蕪；22-28，千禧年之後將有最後復活和最終審判；29-35，對主而言，所有的事物都是屬靈的；36-39，魔鬼及其徒眾被逐出天庭，去誘惑世人；40-45，墜落和贖罪帶來救恩；46-50，小孩子藉贖罪而得救贖。

text.en: Who will gather his people even as a hen gathereth her chickens under her wings, even as many as will hearken to my voice and humble themselves before me, and call upon me in mighty prayer.
text.zh: 聽耶穌基督，你們的救贖主，偉大而自有永有者的聲音，祂慈悲之臂已贖了你們的罪；

text.en: Behold, verily, verily, I say unto you, that at this time your sins are forgiven you, therefore ye receive these things; but remember to sin no more, lest perils shall come upon you.
text.zh: 祂要像母雞把小雞聚集在翅膀底下那樣聚集祂的人民，即所有聽我的聲音，在我面前謙卑，並盡力禱告呼求我的人。

text.en: Verily, I say unto you that ye are chosen out of the world to declare my gospel with the sound of rejoicing, as with the voice of a trump.
text.zh: 看啊，我實實在在告訴你們，此時你們的罪赦了，所以你們才能接受這些事；但是記住，不要再犯罪，以免危難臨到你們。

text.en: Lift up your hearts and be glad, for I am in your midst, and am your advocate with the Father; and it is his good will to give you the kingdom.
text.zh: 我實在告訴你們，你們是從世上揀選出來的，要用喜悅的語調和號角般的聲音，宣揚我的福音。

text.en: And, as it is written—Whatsoever ye shall ask in faith, being united in prayer according to my command, ye shall receive.
text.zh: 你們要滿懷高興，因為我在你們中間，在父面前作你們的中保；把國度給你們是祂的美意。

text.en: And ye are called to bring to pass the gathering of mine elect; for mine elect hear my voice and harden not their hearts;
text.zh: 而且，正如記載所說——你們憑信心，照我的命令同心祈禱，無論求什麼，都必得到。

text.en: Wherefore the decree hath gone forth from the Father that they shall be gathered in unto one place upon the face of this land, to prepare their hearts and be prepared in all things against the day when tribulation and desolation are sent forth upon the wicked.
text.zh: 你們蒙召促成我選民的聚集；因為我的選民聽我的聲音，也不硬起他們的心；

text.en: For the hour is nigh and the day soon at hand when the earth is ripe; and all the proud and they that do wickedly shall be as stubble; and I will burn them up, saith the Lord of Hosts, that wickedness shall not be upon the earth;
text.zh: 因此父已發布命令，他們將聚集在此地的一個地點，為苦難和荒蕪降臨惡人的日子，作好內心及各方面的準備。

text.en: For the hour is nigh, and that which was spoken by mine apostles must be fulfilled; for as they spoke so shall it come to pass;
text.zh: 因為時辰近了，大地成熟的日子近了；所有驕傲和作惡的必如碎稭；萬軍之主說，我要將他們燒盡，使大地沒有邪惡；

text.en: For I will reveal myself from heaven with power and great glory, with all the hosts thereof, and dwell in righteousness with men on earth a thousand years, and the wicked shall not stand.
text.zh: 因為時辰近了，我的使徒所說的都必應驗；因為他們怎麼說，事情就必怎麼樣；

text.en: And again, verily, verily, I say unto you, and it hath gone forth in a firm decree, by the will of the Father, that mine apostles, the Twelve which were with me in my ministry at Jerusalem, shall stand at my right hand at the day of my coming in a pillar of fire, being clothed with robes of righteousness, with crowns upon their heads, in glory even as I am, to judge the whole house of Israel, even as many as have loved me and kept my commandments, and none else.
text.zh: 因為我要以能力和極大榮耀，帶著所有天軍，自天上顯現，在正義中與人同住世上一千年，那時惡人必站立不住。

text.en: For a trump shall sound both long and loud, even as upon Mount Sinai, and all the earth shall quake, and they shall come forth—yea, even the dead which died in me, to receive a crown of righteousness, and to be clothed upon, even as I am, to be with me, that we may be one.
text.zh: 我再實實在在告訴你們，有個不變的命令，已奉父的旨意頒佈了，就是我的使徒們，我在耶路撒冷傳道時和我一起的十二位，到我在火柱中降臨那天，必身穿正義之袍，頭戴冠冕，像我一樣榮耀，站在我右邊，審判全以色列家族，就是所有曾愛我並遵守我誡命的人，而沒有別人。

text.en: But, behold, I say unto you that before this great day shall come the sun shall be darkened, and the moon shall be turned into blood, and the stars shall fall from heaven, and there shall be greater signs in heaven above and in the earth beneath;
text.zh: 因為號角聲將如在西奈山上那樣吹得又長又響，全地必震動，他們要出來——是的，就是死在我裡面的人，要接受正義的冠冕，像我一樣穿戴，與我同在，好使我們合而為一。

text.en: And there shall be weeping and wailing among the hosts of men;
text.zh: 但是，看啊，我告訴你們，這大日子要來之前，太陽必昏暗，月亮要變為血，眾星要從天上墜落，天上地下將有更大的徵兆；

text.en: And there shall be a great hailstorm sent forth to destroy the crops of the earth.
text.zh: 人群中將哭泣哀號；

text.en: And it shall come to pass, because of the wickedness of the world, that I will take vengeance upon the wicked, for they will not repent; for the cup of mine indignation is full; for behold, my blood shall not cleanse them if they hear me not.
text.zh: 必有大冰雹來毀壞地上的莊稼。

text.en: Wherefore, I the Lord God will send forth flies upon the face of the earth, which shall take hold of the inhabitants thereof, and shall eat their flesh, and shall cause maggots to come in upon them;
text.zh: 事情將是這樣，由於世人的邪惡，我要向惡人報復，因為他們不肯悔改；因為我憤怒之杯已滿；因為看啊，如果他們不聽我的話，我的血必不潔淨他們。

text.en: And their tongues shall be stayed that they shall not utter against me; and their flesh shall fall from off their bones, and their eyes from their sockets;
text.zh: 因此，我，主神，必降蒼蠅到地面上附在居民身上，吃他們的肉，使他們的身體長蛆；

text.en: And it shall come to pass that the beasts of the forest and the fowls of the air shall devour them up.
text.zh: 他們將結舌無法張口反對我；他們的肌肉將脫骨而落，他們的眼珠要離眶而墜；

text.en: And the great and abominable church, which is the whore of all the earth, shall be cast down by devouring fire, according as it is spoken by the mouth of Ezekiel the prophet, who spoke of these things, which have not come to pass but surely must, as I live, for abominations shall not reign.
text.zh: 事情將是這樣，林中的走獸和空中的飛鳥將吞吃他們。

text.en: And again, verily, verily, I say unto you that when the thousand years are ended, and men again begin to deny their God, then will I spare the earth but for a little season;
text.zh: 那大而可憎的教會，那全地之娼，將如先知以西結所說的，被吞滅的火推倒，他說過這些事，像我活著一樣，這些事雖還未到，但必然如此，因為憎行必無法得逞。

text.en: And the end shall come, and the heaven and the earth shall be consumed and pass away, and there shall be a new heaven and a new earth.
text.zh: 我再實實在在告訴你們，一千年結束後，世人又開始否認他們的神，我會放過大地一段短時期；

text.en: For all old things shall pass away, and all things shall become new, even the heaven and the earth, and all the fulness thereof, both men and beasts, the fowls of the air, and the fishes of the sea;
text.zh: 然後末期來到，天地要被毀滅而消逝，接著將有新天新地。

text.en: And not one hair, neither mote, shall be lost, for it is the workmanship of mine hand.
text.zh: 因為一切舊的都要消逝，萬物都必更新，天和地、天地間的萬物、人與獸、空中的飛鳥、海中的魚都要更新；

text.en: But, behold, verily I say unto you, before the earth shall pass away, Michael, mine archangel, shall sound his trump, and then shall all the dead awake, for their graves shall be opened, and they shall come forth—yea, even all.
text.zh: 一根頭髮，一點微塵都不會失落，因為那是我親手造的。

text.en: And the righteous shall be gathered on my right hand unto eternal life; and the wicked on my left hand will I be ashamed to own before the Father;
text.zh: 但是，看啊，我實在告訴你們，大地消逝以前，我的天使長米迦勒會吹起號角，死者都要醒來，因為他們的墳墓會被打開，他們會出來——是的，所有的死者。

text.en: Wherefore I will say unto them—Depart from me, ye cursed, into everlasting fire, prepared for the devil and his angels.
text.zh: 義人將聚集在我右邊得永生；惡人將在我左邊，我在父面前恥於擁有他們；

text.en: And now, behold, I say unto you, never at any time have I declared from mine own mouth that they should return, for where I am they cannot come, for they have no power.
text.zh: 因此我要對他們說——你們這些受詛罰的，離開我，到那為魔鬼和魔鬼使者們準備的永恆之火中去。

text.en: But remember that all my judgments are not given unto men; and as the words have gone forth out of my mouth even so shall they be fulfilled, that the first shall be last, and that the last shall be first in all things whatsoever I have created by the word of my power, which is the power of my Spirit.
text.zh: 現在，看啊，我告訴你們，我的口從未宣布過他們能回來，我所在的地方他們不能來，因為他們沒有能力。

text.en: For by the power of my Spirit created I them; yea, all things both spiritual and temporal—
text.zh: 但是記住，我的審判並未完全向世人顯明；我的口怎麼說的，就必怎樣應驗，就是我藉我能力的話語，即我靈的能力，創造的所有的事物，在前的將要在後，在後的將要在前。

text.en: First spiritual, secondly temporal, which is the beginning of my work; and again, first temporal, and secondly spiritual, which is the last of my work—
text.zh: 因為我藉我靈的能力創造了一切；是的，屬靈和屬世的所有事物——

text.en: Speaking unto you that you may naturally understand; but unto myself my works have no end, neither beginning; but it is given unto you that ye may understand, because ye have asked it of me and are agreed.
text.zh: 首先屬靈的，其次屬世的，這是我事工的開始；然後，首先屬世的，其次屬靈的，就是我事工的終結——

text.en: Wherefore, verily I say unto you that all things unto me are spiritual, and not at any time have I given unto you a law which was temporal; neither any man, nor the children of men; neither Adam, your father, whom I created.
text.zh: 這樣說，好使你們易於了解，但是對我來說，我的事工沒有結束，也沒有開始；然而你們既同心求問我，我就這樣對你們說，好讓你們了解。

text.en: Behold, I gave unto him that he should be an agent unto himself; and I gave unto him commandment, but no temporal commandment gave I unto him, for my commandments are spiritual; they are not natural nor temporal, neither carnal nor sensual.
text.zh: 因此，我實在告訴你們，對我來說，所有的事物都是屬靈的，我從未給你們屬世的律法；沒有給過任何人，沒有給過人類兒女，也沒有給過你們的祖先，即我所創造的亞當。

text.en: And it came to pass that Adam, being tempted of the devil—for, behold, the devil was before Adam, for he rebelled against me, saying, Give me thine honor, which is my power; and also a third part of the hosts of heaven turned he away from me because of their agency;
text.zh: 看啊，我給他的是要他作自己的主宰；我給他誡命，但沒給他屬世的誡命，因為我的誡命都是屬靈的，不是自然的，也不是屬世的，不是屬肉慾的，也不是屬情慾的。

text.en: And they were thrust down, and thus came the devil and his angels;
text.zh: 事情是這樣的，亞當受了魔鬼的誘惑——因為，看啊，魔鬼在亞當面前，因為他背叛我，說，把你的榮譽給我，那是我的能力；他還使天上群眾的三分之一因他們的選擇權而背離我；

text.en: And, behold, there is a place prepared for them from the beginning, which place is hell.
text.zh: 他們被丟下去，因而有了魔鬼和他的使者；

text.en: And it must needs be that the devil should tempt the children of men, or they could not be agents unto themselves; for if they never should have bitter they could not know the sweet—
text.zh: 而且，看啊，從太初就為他們準備好一個地方，那地方就是地獄。

text.en: Wherefore, it came to pass that the devil tempted Adam, and he partook of the forbidden fruit and transgressed the commandment, wherein he became subject to the will of the devil, because he yielded unto temptation.
text.zh: 魔鬼誘惑人類兒女是必要的，否則他們無法成為自己的主宰；因為他們如果未嘗過苦，就不知道甜——

text.en: Wherefore, I, the Lord God, caused that he should be cast out from the Garden of Eden, from my presence, because of his transgression, wherein he became spiritually dead, which is the first death, even that same death which is the last death, which is spiritual, which shall be pronounced upon the wicked when I shall say: Depart, ye cursed.
text.zh: 因此事情是這樣的，魔鬼誘惑了亞當，他吃了禁果，違反了誡命，變得順從魔鬼的意思，因為他向誘惑屈服。

text.en: But, behold, I say unto you that I, the Lord God, gave unto Adam and unto his seed, that they should not die as to the temporal death, until I, the Lord God, should send forth angels to declare unto them repentance and redemption, through faith on the name of mine Only Begotten Son.
text.zh: 因此，我，主神，因他違誡而使他被趕出伊甸園，離開我面前，於是他在屬靈方面死了，那是第一次死亡，和最後的死亡一樣；那是屬靈的死亡，當我說：你們這些受詛咒的，離開我，就是對惡人宣告這種死亡。

text.en: And thus did I, the Lord God, appoint unto man the days of his probation—that by his natural death he might be raised in immortality unto eternal life, even as many as would believe;
text.zh: 但是，看啊，我告訴你們，我，主神，讓亞當和他的後裔不會有屬世的死亡，直到我，主神，派天使向他們宣講藉著對我獨生子之名的信心而來的悔改和救贖。

text.en: And they that believe not unto eternal damnation; for they cannot be redeemed from their spiritual fall, because they repent not;
text.zh: 因此我，主神，指定給世人受驗證的日子——好使凡是相信的人，在自然死亡後，能復活不死而得到永生。

text.en: For they love darkness rather than light, and their deeds are evil, and they receive their wages of whom they list to obey.
text.zh: 但不信的人就得到永恆的懲罰；因為他們不悔改，不能從屬靈的墜落中得到救贖；

text.en: But behold, I say unto you, that little children are redeemed from the foundation of the world through mine Only Begotten;
text.zh: 因為他們愛黑暗而不愛光明，他們的行為邪惡，他們就由他們所選擇服從的對象領取酬賞。

text.en: Wherefore, they cannot sin, for power is not given unto Satan to tempt little children, until they begin to become accountable before me;
text.zh: 但是看啊，我告訴你們，小孩子從世界奠基以來就由我的獨生子救贖了；

text.en: For it is given unto them even as I will, according to mine own pleasure, that great things may be required at the hand of their fathers.
text.zh: 所以，他們不能犯罪，因為沒有給撒但能力去誘惑小孩子，直到他們開始能在我面前負責的時候；

text.en: And, again, I say unto you, that whoso having knowledge, have I not commanded to repent?
text.zh: 這樣待他們是我的意思，是我所樂意的，這樣才好向他們的父親手中要求重大的事。
